Right now our snake’s head is at (8,9). Our own body occupies (7,9) and (6,9) so going left would immediately bite ourselves, and going up would take us off the board (y=10). That leaves RIGHT and DOWN as safe choices.

That move keeps us away from the board’s boundary, but doesn’t guide us toward any specific apple right away.

With the enemy snake far away and no immediate risk of trapping ourselves, heading RIGHT to (9,9) remains an acceptable plan. It preserves our safe directions afterward as we can then reorient our path to target an apple later. I’ll note as a future strategy that once we’re near the board edge we’ll need to be careful with our next move choices—likely heading DOWN from (9,9) to keep our options open for reaching, say, the apple at (9,5) eventually.

Thus, for the next move, I decide to go RIGHT.

I’ll choose DOWN.
